Package planetarium.solarsystem

Class Star

java.lang.Object
planetarium.solarsystem.CelestialBody
planetarium.solarsystem.Star
public class Star extends CelestialBody
Represent a star, the center of its solar system.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    MAX_NUMBER_OF_PLANETS
    The maximum number of planets that can orbit a star.

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()
      Getter method for the absolute position of the star.
      Specified by:
      getPosition in class CelestialBody
      Returns:
      Returns the position of the star relaltive to an arbitrary origin, equivalent to CelestialBody.getRelativePosition().
      See Also:

    • getPlanets

      public List<Planet> getPlanets()
      Getter method for the list of planets orbiting the star.
      Returns:
      the list of Planet instances orbiting the star.
      See Also:
      • Planet

    • findPlanet

      public Planet findPlanet(String identifier)
      Searches for an instance of a planet around the star given its identifier. WARNING: It does not search for planets orbiting other stars. WARNING: A celestial body that is not a planet will not be found given its identifier.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The identifier of the searched planet.
      Returns:
      the instance of the planet searched. May return null if the planet is not found.
      See Also:
      • Planet

    • addNewPlanet

      public void addNewPlanet(Position planetRelativePosition, long planetMass)
      Creates a new planet orbiting the star. WARNING: It may not create the planet if it exceeds the max number.
      Parameters:
      planetRelativePosition - The new planet's position relative to the star.
      planetMass - The new planet's mass.
      See Also:
      • Planet

    • addNewPlanet

      public void addNewPlanet(long relativeX, long relativeY, long planetMass)
      Creates a new planet orbiting the star. WARNING: It may not create the planet if it exceeds the max number.
      Parameters:
      relativeX - the new planet's offset along the x-axis relative to the star.
      relativeY - the new planet's offset along the y-axis relative to the star.
      planetMass - The new planet's mass.
      See Also:
      • Planet

    • removeOldPlanet

      public void removeOldPlanet(String identifier)
      Removes a planet orbiting the star given an identifier. WARNING: If the identifier corresponds to a planet of another star, the planet will not be deleted.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The identifier of the planet to be removed.
      See Also:
      • Planet
